c3po.fidelity package¶

c3po.fidelity.measurement module¶

Measurement object that communicates between searcher and sim/exp

class c3po.fidelity.measurement.Backend¶

Bases: object

Represents either an experiment or a simulation and contains the methods both need to provide.

class c3po.fidelity.measurement.Experiment(eval_gate=None, eval_seq=None)¶

Bases: c3po.fidelity.measurement.Backend

The driver for an experiment.

calibrate(gate, opts=None, start_name='initial', calib_name='calibrated')¶

Provide a gate to be calibrated with a gradient free search algorithm. At the moment this is CMA-ES and you can give valid opts. See pycma documentation for specifics. Initial sigma is set to 0.5, but you can give scaling for each dimension in the opts dictionary with the ‘CMA_stds’ key. Further ‘ftarget’ sets the goal infidelity and ‘popsize’ the number of samples per generation.

Example for 3 parameters: opts = {

‘CMA_stds’ : [1, 2, 0.5], ‘ftarget’ = 1e-4, ‘popsize’ = 21 }

calibrate_ORBIT(gates, opts=None, start_name='initial', calib_name='calibrated', **kwargs)¶

class c3po.fidelity.measurement.Simulation(model, solve_func)¶

Bases: c3po.fidelity.measurement.Backend

evolution(gate)

constructs gate from parameters by solving equations of motion

gate_fid(gate)

returns findelity of gate vs gate.goal_unitary

dgate_fid(gate)¶

Compute the gradient of the fidelity w.r.t. each parameter of the gate. Formally obtained by the derivative of the gate fidelity. See GOAT paper for details.

gate_fid(gate)¶
update_model(model)¶
